thread.title: Saddam Never Offered Inspectors a Free Hand

author: wsjcom
title: Saddam Never Offered Inspectors a Free Hand
text:
The claim in “Talks With the U.S. Are Not a Reward” (op-ed, April 6) attributed by Ted Rall to a former intelligence officer, that in 2002 Saddam Hussein “offered to admit thousands of U.S. troops to search for weapons of mass destruction” and “promised to hold internationally supervised democratic elections within two years” is inaccurate. To the best of my knowledge as the then-deputy director of the Central Intelligence Agency, U.S. intelligence and the U.S. government more broadly received no such offer from the Iraqi regime.
In...
